block.p: When David Cone heard Tuesday that San Diego pitcher Woody Williams, his former teammate in Toronto, had developed an aneurysm, he called him and they spoke for 10 minutes.

''I just wanted to let him know that he's going to be O.K.,'' said Cone, who had surgery four years ago for a similar aneurysm. ''I also wanted to exchange any information, not only for myself, but for our doctors.'' Williams's doctors have recommended surgery for the 33-year-old right-hander, who was 12-12 last year in San Diego.
When David Cone heard Tuesday that San Diego pitcher Woody Williams, his former teammate in Toronto, had developed an aneurysm, he called him and they spoke for 10 minutes.

''I just wanted to let him know that he's going to be O.K.,'' said Cone, who had surgery four years ago for a similar aneurysm. ''I also wanted to exchange any information, not only for myself, but for our doctors.'' Williams's doctors have recommended surgery for the 33-year-old right-hander, who was 12-12 last year in San Diego.

Cone recovered and rejoined the Yankees at the end of the 1996 season, pitching in the World Series. He won 20 games in 1998 and pitched a perfect game in 1999. ''That's what I tried to tell him: you can come back from this,'' Cone said.
